comment: Vanilla and some lightly burned caramel. Don’t get much else. Quite sharp. If poured neat, it must be on ice in my opinion. Even then, it is just average.

Bronze color when held to the light. Sweet, warm fruit on the nose along with a hint of leather. Body is very vanilla and rich, but not too heavy. Warming. More warmth on the finish along with more vanilla. Very good!
Good base for a rye and ginger.  Nothing close to a neat sipping whisky
Odeur de chocolat/café. Forte première impression d'ethanol, se révèle doux en bouche et assez court.
Lighter, smooth. Vanilla flavors. Easy sipper.
my first foray into the wold of whiskey sipping. so far so good
Doesn't call attention to itself, but easy to drink and smoother than regular CC. Haven't tried CC Reserve yet.
Good, with a good amount of vanilla
Nice vanilla nose, good sipping whisky.
I have drank the 12 year small batch. Which is very good for the low cost per bottle. Its excellent with a few drops of bitters and ice
Really light and buttery. Not much bite at all.
Burnt caramel with subtle vanilla, charred oak dominates. Lingering raw charcoal absolutely prevents it from being a sipping whiskey. It does make a good sour though. $29 in Ontario.

The  small batch version of this is delicious. Yes, it is sweet, but I for one tend to appreciate that in a whisky when the mood strikes. Probably the smoothest whisky I've ever tried. Haven't had the original version, so I can't compare.
pretty smooth.   but about as subbtle as a jackhammer of over sweet caramel.   no need to add simple syrup for an old fashioned with this beast.
Woodsy with hints of caramel at the nose. The palate is a little fruity while the finish falls flat. It's barely drinkable.
Not bad, a little harsh maybe but the price is fair.
Great introduction into whisky, very sweet and smooth, not overly complex though. My girl loves it!
Can’t beat it for the money.smooth and great flavor
Caramel, sweet, light, bite at the end. Great for a cocktail.

One of the few whiskeys I've come close to pouring down the sink.

Caramel. That's all there is. It's sickly sweet, fat, dull, totally devoid of character and costs too much.  Sounds like some politicians.

I've given this half a point in recognition of the fact that it isn't actually poisonous.

"Poor" : 0.5 stars
eh. I'll pass. doesn't taste that well and burns like hell

3.5/5 - If you like standard Canadian blended whisky, you will like this a lot.  Loads of maple, vanilla and sharp ethenol on the nose.  Taste is buttery and sweet, goes down smoothly which is important for Canadian blends, at least to me.   Compaired this to Wisers deluxe, and it blew the doors of it in terms of refinement and depth of flavor.  Not as good as the higher avb/higher rye whiskies but it's a different style.  This one is for fans of classic Canadian blended whisky that don't want anything too harsh.

Deep chestnut appearance, with nice alcohol legs. Aroma of mild, nutty sweet candy and alcohol. Tastes of dried flowers, candied fruit cake fruit, nut oil, and grain. Medium body. The finish is moderately lingering. RJT
$15.25 on sale. Worth a try. Have not sampled yet
Sweet, smooth, and uncomplicated. Nothing to write home about, but overall inoffensive.
Pleasant,friendly, sweet and a good beginners whisky
Like a combination of Glenfiddich and Jameson. Decent Canadian whiskey for a good price. Not my favorite.
Smooth and oaky, this one is always going to have a place on my shelf
After drinking mostly Kentucky bourbon for so long, this old time favorite is a feather weight punch .. nice sweetness and very smooth

It’s all a matter of perspective. When one calls this whisky lacking complexity another can call it highly refined. When one says it’s missing character another can call it exceedingly smooth. To me, CC 12 is probably one of the most refined, sophisticated whiskies available. Does it have bold flavors? Not at all. Does it grab your attention? It’s too well-mannered for that.  What you have here is a pure expression of an elegant Canadian...it’s polite, smooth, and refined. If you seek a brown spirit that will not offend, then look no more, CC12 is it. What Crown Royal claims, CC12 delivers.

Like a lot of the Canadian Club line, it's not an exceptionally deep or complicated spirit, but if you need that, you're looking in the wrong place. Think of the spirit itself to act as a fairly pure vehicle of the long wood essence. The underlying spirits is fairly neutral so you get a lovely expression of undaunted wood and vanilla. It's smooth, but not nearly as much as the blended Scotch of equivalent age (Chivas or Dewars, for instance). A bit of old world meets new world. 

I like it.  But only when I'm in the mood.

Nose: Maple, caramel, toffee, sap, wood spice,dried fruits (raisins, prunes, dates), dark fruits (figs, plum, blackberries) a little orange and candied lemon/lemon rind, sherry,butterscotch, rye greenness, hint of medium roast coffee, hint of pine, sweet creaminess, earthiness (slightest hint of rich tobacco, light chocolate) 

Palate: Caramel, vanilla, toffee, butterscotch, tannins, peppery spice, sherry, slight spicy bitterness, slight creamy sweetness, maple sugar, charred oak, wood sweetness, dried fruit, dark berries 

Finish: Dried fruit, molasses, spicy bitterness, rye, hint of creaminess, fig
vanilla, Walnut,very sweet smooth easy sipper, tiny bit of caramel, nice spice... overall not bad
lijm achtige geur, heel zacht, prima te drinken
Weak to moderate taste. Sweet, fragrant. Suitable for ﾊｲ ボル
Not in my wheelhouse for sipping.  Sweet and warm, vanilla extract taste.

Look: Like a bourbon really: burnt orange, gold hues on the edges.  Lacing, legs.

Nose: sweetness, little to no spice or diversity seems like. Mainly a grainy smell I’d say. Swirling opens more ethanol than I’ve smelled in a whiskey.

Palate: sweet as the nose insinuated, little bit more flavor though. Caramel and vanilla. 

Finish: somewhat astringent, some burn but no barrel at all. Reminds me of a rum almost.

Overall: I use this for manhattans and old fashioneds, but figured I should give it a fair shake. Not the greatest neat.
Perfect hot drink mixing whiskey. Smooth deep maple with a bitter sweet chocolate edge. Walnuts on finish. Maple wood smell
